intro: Daviesia oxylobium, commonly known as the narrow-leaf hakea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and dense foliage. The plant produces clusters of small, pink to reddish flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Daviesia oxylobium is typically found in heathlands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils.
